properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 10 at 3:28PM CST until January 11 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Topeka KS
properties.description:
...Dangerous Travel Conditions Likely Friday Night through
Saturday...

A complex winter system will continue to impact the region
through the day tomorrow. A light wintry mix is expected this
evening before a brief lull in precipitation occurs tonight.
Another batch of winter weather is then expected to move in
tomorrow morning, mainly across eastern Kansas. Tomorrow's round
of weather will be all snow and could fall moderate to heavy at
times during the morning.

* WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation will taper off tonight before a
batch of moderate to heavy snow moves in tomorrow morning. Total
snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches and ice accumulations of
around one tenth of an inch are expected. Winds could gust as
high as 40 mph.

* WHERE...Douglas, Osage, Franklin, Coffey and Anderson Counties.

* WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 6 PM CST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow could
significantly reduce visibility.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The first of two rounds of wintry
precipitation will taper off tonight before a round of moderate
to heavy snow moves into the area tomorrow morning.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST SATURDAY
